titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the second half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the second half of the year (fols. 3ra-181rc) I-1) Mäggabit (fols. 3ra-35vb) I-2) Miyazya (fols. 36ra-60va) I-3) Gǝnbot (fols. 61ra-93rb) I-4) Säne (fols. 94ra-122vc) I-5) Ḥamle (fols. 123ra-155ra) I-6) Näḥase (fols. 156ra-176rb) I-7) Ṗagwǝmen (fols. 177ra-181ra) - Postscript (commissioner's statement): fol. 181ra - Zä-ʾaqräbku maḫletä... “The song I am offering...” (concluding prayer): fol. 181ra-rb The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: Gǝrma Ṣǝyon is mentioned as the commissioner of the Ms. in the postscript and in Additio 2. His name and the names of other individuals are written in supplication formulas throughout the Ms.: Gǝrma Ṣǝyon (e.g., fols. 3vb, 4va, 46ra, 66rb, 90ra, 106rc, 146va, 170rc), his father Läbase Krǝstos (e.g., fols. 5vc, 7rb, 47ra, 66rb, 90ra, 106rb, 146va), Wäldä Krǝstos (e.g., fols. 3ra, 3vab), ʾabunä ʾAskalä Maryam (e.g., fols. 171vb, 172rac, 173ra), ʾabunä ʾAskalä Dǝngǝl (e.g., fols. 172rabc, 173ra, 174ra).

dcomments.dcomment: King ʾƎgwalä Ṣǝyon (r. 1801-18) is mentioned in supplication formulas on fols. 3ra and 16vb.

txstates.txstate: The back board, the leather cover and the overback have been severly damaged by insects. The leather cover and the overback are torn off from the edges. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 35, 38, 91.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Overback made of brown tooled leather. Spinelining made of a piece of parchment. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the brown leather cover (at least 10 tools were used: triple line fillet, fourfold line fillet, double circle, Maltese-cross, corni-form, cross hatching, hatching with dots, criss-cross, wave form, double sine wave with dots). Blind tooled ornament on the brown overback (at least 1 tool is used: triple line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, no stub; 2, no stub/fols. 1r-2v) — I(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 6; 7, stub after 3/fols. 3r-12v) — II(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 3/fols. 13r-22v) — III(10/fols. 23r-32v) — IV(4/fols. 33r-36v) — V(10/fols. 37r-46v) — VI(10/fols. 47r-56v) — VII(4; s.l.: 2, stub after 3; 3, stub after 2/fols. 57r-60v) — VIII(10/fols. 61r-70v) — IX(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 71r-80v) — X(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4/fols. 81r-90v) — XI(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 1/fols. 91r-93v) — XII(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 94r-103v) — XIII(8/fols. 104r-111v) — XIV(11; s.l.: 11, stub before 1/fols. 112r-122v) — XV(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4/fols. 123r-132v) — XVI(10/fols. 133r-142v) — XVII(6/fols. 143r-148v) — XVIII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 149r-155v) — XIX(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 156r-165v) — XX(6; s.l.: 3, stub after 4; 4, stub after 3/fols. 166r-171v) — XXI(5; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 172r-176v) — XXII(6; s.l.: 1, stub after 5; 6, stub before1/fols. 177r-182v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible (e.g., fols. 76, 117). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the ruler, the commissioner and other individuals; a few lines (alternating with black lines) and one group of lines in the incipit page of each section of the text; two initial lines of the first commemorative notice of the day and one initial line of the subsequent commemorative notices of the day; the word sälam opening the sälam-hymns; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

additional.cont: Fols. 35vb-36rc: Tarik zä-täṣəḥfä bä-mäwaˁəlihomu lä-näguśä nägäśt Yoḥannəs..., "History that was written in the time of the King of Kings Yoḥannəs...", a short historiographic composition.
additional.det: The note, in a mediocre hand, was written during the time of King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89), nǝburä ʾǝd ʾIyasu and ʾabba Täklä Haymanot and ʾaläqa Täklä ʾƎsṭifanos from Gondär (the scribe?) "who was with them". The note is a list of metropolitans of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church from ʾabba Sälama to ʾabunä ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1867-76), with description of some events. It contains 107 names. Besides, it mentions some rulers of Ethiopia and events that took place when they were in power, such as King Susǝnyos and the arrival of the Catholic priests, the restoration of the Orthodox faith, the rule of King ʾIyasu, the conflict between däğğazmač Wube and ras ʿAli, the death of ʾAtnatewos at ʿAdwa.

additional.cont: Fol. 181rb-rc: Extensive donation note.
additional.det: The note is written in the main hand. It states that the commissioner of the Ms. is ʾabba Gǝrma Ṣǝyon who donated it to the Däbrä Dammo monastery.

extras.extra: - The title ስንክሳር and the internal number of the monastic library (384) are written on fol. 1r. - Four lines of the incipit of the Synaxarion are written four times on fol. 2r.
